collections.name: Greek Alphabet
collections.description: Greek letters with standard alphabetical order, lowercase/uppercase forms, classical names, letter type classification, and pronunciation guides split into Classical vs Modern (IPA + simple helpers).

collections.name: Greek Mythology
collections.description: Consolidated Greek mythology entries (Olympians, Titans, Primordials, Chthonic).

collections.name: Counter + Culture Set 01
collections.description: Ichidan verbs with counters, proper nouns, and culturally useful notes.

collections.name: Verb Variety Set 01
collections.description: Sentences using godan -ぐ verbs with varied conjugations and proper nouns.

collections.name: Full Examples (repaired v1)
collections.description: Old examples reviewed and conformed to japanese.examples schema

collections.name: adj forms (i/na unified where possible)
collections.description: Core adjective morphology and high-frequency derivational suffixes. Uses [adj] when a form applies productively to both i-adj and na-adj (with class-specific stem handling as needed). When forms differ, i/na variants are adjacent. Negative copula results (じゃない / ではない) are treated as i-adj because they enter the i-adj inflection pipeline. Some entries include second-order productive morphology (e.g., verb-conditionals applied to derivational verbs like すぎる); these are included when the derived form is productive and high-frequency.

collections.name: All Japanese Words
collections.description: First-generation Japanese words from various sources including dictionaries and language databases.

collections.name: Language History
collections.description: Combined language history entries

collections.name: Foundational & Methodological
collections.description: General-purpose linguistic, methodological, and academic terms used across subfields.

collections.name: Lexical Semantics & Lexicon (lexical_semantics)
collections.description: Word meaning, sense structure, and lexical relations.

collections.name: Lexical Semantics & Lexicon (lexical)
collections.description: Word meaning, sense structure, and lexical relations.

collections.name: Orthography, Diacritics & Writing Systems (orthography_diacritics)
collections.description: Terms related to writing systems, diacritics, and orthographic conventions, including Ancient and Modern Greek.

collections.name: Orthography, Diacritics & Writing Systems (orthography_greek)
collections.description: Terms related to writing systems, diacritics, and orthographic conventions, including Ancient and Modern Greek.

collections.name: Phonology & Prosody
collections.description: Sound structure and prosodic systems such as stress and pitch accent.

collections.name: Pragmatics & Context
collections.description: Contextual meaning, inference, and language use.

collections.name: Semantics
collections.description: Core meaning relations and meaning change.

collections.name: Syntax
collections.description: Clause/phrase structure and relations such as embedding and subordination.

collections.name: Pokémon Starters (Kanto)
collections.description: First-generation Kanto starter Pokémon and first 151 Pokémon. Pokémon `type` values use the official Japanese main-series game type labels (e.g., ノーマル, ほのお, みず, でんき, くさ, どく, ひこう, etc.). Name root fields capture both surface segmentation and etymology for Japanese and English names.

collections.name: Programming
collections.description: Consolidated programming collections: languages, SQL engines, web technologies.

collections.name: Periodic Table – First 70 Elements
collections.description: Atomic number, symbol, and core properties for the first 70 elements of the periodic table.
